column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Four further Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.  The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 464 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Monday
column5: 405 on Sunday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.On Monday
column7: there were 340 Covid inpatients in hospitals across Northern Ireland
column8: down from 370 on Friday when the Department of Health's Covid-19 dashboard was last updated.Twenty-eight people were being treated in intensive care units (ICU)
column9: down from 33 on Friday.Last updated 29 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 3

column17: 431 were third doses of the vaccine. The remainder were booster jabs. Last updated 29 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 4
